{{Infobox motorsport championship | name = SCCA Formula Super Vee | logo = | image-size = | caption = | category = [[Formula Super Vee]] | country = {{flagicon|USA}} [[United States of America]]
{{flagicon|CAN}} [[Canada]]
{{flagicon|MEX}} [[Mexico]] | region = | inaugural = 1971 | folded = 1990 | constructors = Various | engines = [[Volkswagen]] | champion driver = {{flagicon|USA}} [[Stuart Crow]] | manufacturer = [[Ralt]] }} The '''SCCA Formula Super Vee''' was one of the longest running [[Formula Super Vee]] championships in the world. Twenty racing season were contested. Most of the races were sanctioned by the [[Sports Car Club of America]] in some occasions the races were sanctioned by the [[International Motor Sports Association]]. ==History== In 1969 Josef Hoppen, head of the motorsport department of [[Volkswagen of America]], approached the [[Sports Car Club of America]]. The Formula Super Vee was announced as an SCCA national class in November 1969.{{cite journal|title=Super Vee|journal=Vee Line|date=November 1969|issue=62|pages=1, 4|url=http://www.formulavee.us/vee_lines/VeeLine%2062%20Nov%2069.pdf|accessdate=27 July 2015}}{{cite web|title=Formula Super Vee History|url=http://home.comcast.net/~yspect8/hist_fsv_reg/history.htm|website=Historic Formula Super Vee Register|accessdate=27 July 2015}} The class was created as a substitute for the overpopulated [[Formula Vee]] class.{{cite journal|title=1600 for 1970|journal=Vee Lines|date=October 1969|issue=61|pages=1, 4|url=http://www.formulavee.us/vee_lines/VeeLine%2061%20Oct%2069.pdf|accessdate=27 July 2015}} [[Beach Racing Cars]] manufactured the first Super Vee car, a single seater using threaded tires and no aerodynamic aides. Settled Formula Vee constructors [[Zink Cars]], Autodynamics and [[Zeitler Racing Design]] soon followed.{{cite journal|title=Super Vee|journal=Vee Lines|date=February 1970|issue=64|pages=4|url=http://www.formulavee.us/vee_lines/VeeLine%2064b%20Feb%2070.pdf|accessdate=27 July 2015}} Beach's first Formula Super Vee chassis was bought by Formula Super Vee Europe to promote the racing class in Europe. Thirteen drivers competed in the first edition of the Formula Super Vee [[SCCA National Championship Runoffs]] at [[Road Atlanta]]. Driver/constructor [[John Zeitler]] qualified on pole but dropped to fifth position. [[Tom Davey (racing driver)|Tom Davey]] won the prestigious race also racing a [[Zeitler Racing Design|Zeitler]] chassis.{{cite web|title=SCCA Runoffs Driver Histories|url=http://scca.cdn.racersites.com/prod/assets/12-runoffs-drivers-all.pdf|website=SCCA|accessdate=27 July 2015}} In the combined Formula Super Vee/[[Formula Ford]] race, Super Vee's finished in the first three places. [[Skip Barber]] was the first Formula Ford driver placing fourth overall.{{cite journal|title=Super Vee at Atlanta|journal=Vee Lines|date=December 1970|issue=75|pages=4|url=http://www.formulavee.us/vee_lines/VeeLine%2075%20Dec%2070.pdf|accessdate=27 July 2015}} The first national series was held in 1971. [[Bill Scott (racing driver)|Bill Scott]] won the inaugural race at [[Daytona International Raceway]]. Scott went on to win races at [[Road America]], [[Lime Rock Park]] and [[Laguna Seca Raceway]].{{cite web|title=SCCA Formula Super Vee 1971|url=http://www.oldracingcars.com/fsv/us/FSV1971.jpg|website=Old Racing Cars|accessdate=27 July 2015}} The 1972 season entries improved and slick tires were introduced to the series. Scott became the first double champion of the series despite only winning two races.{{cite web|title=SCCA Formula Super Vee 1972|url=http://www.oldracingcars.com/fsv/us/FSV1972.jpg|website=Old Racing Cars|accessdate=27 July 2015}} For 1973 international drivers stepped in with Swede [[Bertil Roos]] winning three out of the first four races. A late charge from [[Elliott Forbes-Robinson]] could not prevent Roos winning the championship.{{cite web|title=SCCA Formula Super Vee 1973|url=http://www.oldracingcars.com/fsv/us/FSV1973.jpg|website=Old Racing Cars|accessdate=27 July 2015}} In 1974 a new Formula Super Vee era began. The series featured fourteen races, two of them outside the United States. Races abroad were run at [[Mosport Park]], Canada and [[Autódromo Hermanos Rodríguez]], Mexico. Series organizer, Josef Hopen, was not loyal to any specific sanctioning body. Half of the races, including the races abroad, were sanctioned by the [[International Motor Sports Association]]. . The co-sanctioning continued for 1975 but ended before the 1976 season. Political disagreement resulted in Hoppen pulling the Formula Super Vee Robert Bosch championship out of IMSA. As a response IMSA created the [[Formula Atlantic]] class and [[United States Automobile Club|USAC]] created the [[Indy Lights|Mini-Indy Series]] Formula Super Vee.{{cite web|title=SERIES 2 - 1974 - 1976|url=http://www.formulasupervee.com/series-2.html|website=Formula Super Vee|accessdate=27 July 2015}} The next era for Formula Super Vee started in 1978. The class introduced a new, water cooled, [[Volkswagen Rabbit]] engine replacing the old air cooled one. The SCCA club racing scene remained using the old engine. The SCCA dropped the class from its regional and national series, the pro series remained. [[Bill Alsup]] won the first season of the new era Formula Super Vee championship.{{cite web|title=SCCA Formula Super Vee 1978|url=http://www.oldracingcars.com/fsv/us/FSV1978.jpg|website=Old Racing Cars|accessdate=28 July 2015}} [[Ralt]] dominated almost every season fielding the most cars out of any contstructor. {{Infobox officeholder |name = Sarah Godlewski |image = Sarah Godlewski.jpg |office = [[State Treasurer of Wisconsin|Treasurer of Wisconsin]] |status=Elect |governor = [[Tony Evers]] (Elect) |term_start = January 7, 2019 |term end = |succeeding = [[Matt Adamczyk]] |predecessor = [[Matt Adamczyk]] |successor = |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1981|11|9}} |birth_place = [[Eau Claire, Wisconsin|Eau Claire]], [[Wisconsin]], U.S. |death_date = |death_place = |party = [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic]] |spouse = Max Duckworth |education = [[George Mason University]] ([[Bachelor of Arts|BA]])
[[University of Pennsylvania]] ([[Master of Public Administration|MPA]]) }} '''Sarah Ann Godlewski''' (born November 9, 1981){{cite news|title=Thursday's birthdays|url=https://www.politico.com/story/2017/11/09/playbook-birthdays-november-9-244732|accessdate=21 February 2018|issue=9 November 2017|publisher=POLITICO}} is an American entrepreneur, business executive,{{Cite web|url=https://www.jsonline.com/videos/news/2018/04/04/wisconsin-eye-discussion-merits-state-treasurers-office/33536395/|title=Wisconsin Eye discussion on the merits of the State Treasurer's office|website=Milwaukee Journal Sentinel|language=en|access-date=2018-04-12}} and [[Politics of the United States|politician]] from the [[U.S. state|state]] of [[Wisconsin]].{{cite web|title=Sarah Godlewski: Executive Profile|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/research/stocks/private/person.asp?personId=411261340&privcapId=401985532&previousCapId=401985532&previousTitle=Masa%20Impact,%20LLC|website=Bloomberg|accessdate=21 February 2018}} A [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democrat]], she worked for the [[U.S. Department of Defense]] before co-founding [https://masaimpact.com/ MaSa Impact], a [https://www.investopedia.com/terms/s/sri.asp socially responsible investment] venture. Godlewski was elected to the position of [[Wisconsin State Treasurer]] in the November [[Wisconsin elections, 2018#Treasurer|2018 election]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.usnews.com/news/best-states/wisconsin/articles/2018-04-04/democrat-godlewski-registers-to-run-for-treasurer|title=US News and World Report|last=|first=|date=|work=|access-date=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.nbc15.com/content/news/Democrat-Godlewski-registers-to-run-for-treasurer-478760343.html|title=Democrat enters treasurer race after fighting to save office|last=NBC15|access-date=2018-04-12|language=en}} Godlewski was the founder of the Save Our Fiscal Watchdog Committee,{{cite news|url=http://host.madison.com/ct/opinion/column/sarah-godlewski-vote-no-on-amendment-to-dump-state-treasurer/article_64b76bf8-bb15-5697-9888-688bd82026cd.html|title=Vote ‘No’ on amendment to dump state treasurer|last1=Godlewski|first1=Sarah|date=March 15, 2018|newspaper=The Capital Times|accessdate=15 March 2018}} a successful effort which defeated an April 2018 proposed amendment to the [[Wisconsin Constitution]] to remove the office of State Treasurer.Wisconsin Legislative Reference Bureau, "2015 Enrolled Joint Resolution 7: Constitutional Amendment Approved on First Consideration to Eliminate the Office of the State Treasurer," June 2016{{Cite news|url=http://cvpost.org/memorial-grad-sets-up-her-own-company-returns-to-eau-claire-and-helps-lead-efforts-to-retain-state-treasurers-office/|title=Memorial grad sets up her own company, returns to Eau Claire and helps lead efforts to retain State Treasurer's office - Chippewa Valley Post|date=2018-03-31|work=Chippewa Valley Post|access-date=2018-04-12|language=en-US}} Godlewski led the statewide effort with former [[Republican Party (United States)|Republican]] State Treasurer [[Jack Voight]].{{cite web|url=http://www.chicagotribune.com/news/nationworld/midwest/ct-wisconsin-treasurer-election-20180318-story.html|title=Wisconsin voters to decide on whether to eliminate state treasurer's office|last1=Bauer|first1=Scott|website=Chicago Tribune|publisher=Associated Press|accessdate=31 March 2018}} ==Early life and career== Godlewski was born in [[Eau Claire, Wisconsin]] and is a graduate of [[Memorial High School (Eau Claire, Wisconsin)|Memorial High School]], where she was class president. She attended college at [[George Mason University]], where she studied Peace and Conflict Resolution and served as student body president. During that time, she helped to successfully lobby the [[Virginia Legislature]] to pass [[absentee ballot]] reforms.{{cite news|last1=Helderman|first1=Rosalind|title=Va. Students' Standards of Lobbying|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/local/2004/02/08/va-students-standards-of-lobbying/2c36228b-ba1f-4b13-b27c-3c58ac1860ab/|accessdate=21 February 2018|publisher=The Washington Post|date=8 February 2004}} Later, she attended the [[Sorensen Institute for Political Leadership]] at the [[University of Virginia]] and received a [[Masters in Public Administration]] from the [[University of Pennsylvania]]. In addition, she was a National Security Fellow for [[Air War College]] and attended the Women's Campaign School at [[Yale University]]. Godlewski has also been involved as an interviewer with the [[Veterans History Project]]. [[Image:Sarah_Godlewski_and_Hillary_Clinton.jpg|thumb|right|Godlewski with Hillary Clinton in 2016]] Godlewski worked for [[Arapahoe County, Colorado]] from 2012 to 2016 as the Director of the Department of Strategy and Performance.{{cite news|title=FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE: Arapahoe County hires new Director of Performance Management Sarah Godlewski will support and assist departments, elected offices with the County’s Align Arapahoe initiatives and performance measures|url=http://www.co.arapahoe.co.us/Archive/ViewFile/Item/146|accessdate=21 February 2018|agency=Arapahoe County|date=18 December 2012}} During that time, Godlewski served as a member of the Joint Taskforce on Veterans with PTSD which made recommendations to the [[Department of Veterans Affairs]] and the [[United States Congress]]. Godlewski worked for [[Booz Allen Hamilton]] on Strategy and Organization in [[Washington, D.C.]] and was a senior consultant at [[BearingPoint]]. During the 2008 and [[US presidential campaign, 2008|United States 2008 Presidential Election]]s, Godlewski served as the national finance council co-chair for [[Ready for Hillary]] and was the Wisconsin Women's Director for [[Hillary Clinton presidential campaign, 2016|Hillary Clinton's 2016 presidential bid]]. Godlewski has also taught as an [[Adjunct professors in North America|adjunct professor]] at George Mason University. Godlewski's career has lead her to work on community [[Microfinance]] in [[India]], language and culture strategic planning for the [[United States Department of State]], child protection initiatives in [[Belize]], education reform and public health in [[Uganda]],{{cite news|last1=Bahrampour|first1=Tara|title=Learning Experience After building a life in Arlington, Ugandan immigrant John Wanda decided to build something more ambitious -- a school for his native village|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/lifestyle/magazine/2006/05/21/learning-experience-span-classbankheadafter-building-a-life-in-arlington-ugandan-immigrant-john-wanda-decided-to-build-something-more-ambitious-a-school-for-his-native-village-span/cdaee937-65bc-4c1f-88b9-2c9b62dfb2b1/|accessdate=21 February 2018|publisher=The Washington Post|date=21 May 2006}} and social policy work in [[Sweden]]. Godlewski serves on the board for the [[U.S. Fund for UNICEF]] and serves as chairperson of the UNICEF Advocacy Committee. In addition to her leadership role with [[UNICEF]], Godlewski serves on the board for mOm Incubators,{{cite news|title=Innovators & Disruptors: The 2017 Tech 25|url=http://washingtonlife.com/2017/11/07/2017-tech-25/|accessdate=22 February 2018|publisher=Washington Magazine|date=7 November 2017}} the [[Arlington Academy of Hope]], and [[George Mason University#Colleges and schools|George Mason University's School of Visual and Performance Arts]]. Godlewski has also been an investor with WE Capital.{{cite web|title=Interview: Sarah Godlewski|url=http://iknowpolitics.org/en/learn/interviews/sarah-godlewski|website=iKnowPolitics|accessdate=21 February 2018}} In the past, Godlewski has helped to direct Women's Leadership programs for the [[Democratic National Committee]].{{cite news|last1=Smith|first1=Hillary|title=Panel discussion explores women’s role in politics, impact of Clinton candidacy|url=https://www.spectatornews.com/campus-news/2016/10/12/panel-discussion/|accessdate=31 March 2018|publisher=The Spectator|date=12 October 2016}} === Campaign for Treasurer === In April 2018, Godlewski announced her candidacy for State Treasurer. Godlewski won a three-way primary with 43% of the vote on August 14, 2018.{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/08/14/us/elections/results-wisconsin-primary-elections.html|title=Wisconsin Primary Election Results|last=Almukhtar|first=Sarah|access-date=2018-08-16|language=en}} Her opponents were former television anchor Cynthia Kaump and former Treasurer [[Dawn Marie Sass]]. In the general election on November 6, Godlewski won the election with 51 percent of the vote.{{Cite news|url=https://www.wisconsinrapidstribune.com/story/news/2018/11/07/wisconsin-elections-democrat-sarah-godlewski-leads-state-treasurer-race/1835960002/|title=Wisconsin elections: Democrat Sarah Godlewski wins state treasurer race|work=Daily Tribune Media|access-date=2018-11-08|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.wbay.com/content/news/Democrat-Godlewski-wins-State-Treasurers-office-499911642.html|title=Democrat Godlewski wins State Treasurer's office|last=WBAY|access-date=2018-11-08|language=en}} ==Personal life== Sarah's parents are retired public school teachers. Godlewski lives with her husband Max and their rescue dog, Tanner.{{Cite web|url=http://www.sarahforwisconsin.com/meet-sarah|title=Meet Sarah|website=Sarah for Wisconsin|language=en-US|access-date=2018-04-12}} ==Notes== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://masaimpact.com/about-sarah-godlewski/ Sarah Godlewski Biography] *[https://www.sarahforwisconsin.com/meet-sarah/ State Treasurer Campaign Website] {{s-start}} {{s-off}} {{s-bef|before=[[Matt Adamczyk]]}} {{s-ttl|title=[[List of State Treasurers of Wisconsin|Treasurer of Wisconsin]]

page.title: Strelnikoff Mary of Help of Brezje controversy

revision.comment: Moving from [[Category:Catholic Church-related controversies]] to [[Category:Catholicism-related controversies]] using [[c:Help:Cat-a-lot|Cat-a-lot]]
revision.text:
{{Use dmy dates|date=February 2014}} [[File:Strelnikoff-Bitchcraft.jpg|thumb|right|''Bitchcraft'' album cover]] The '''Strelnikoff Mary of Help of Brezje controversy''' or the '''Strelnikoff Affair''' ({{lang-sl|Afera Strelnikoff}})<ref name="Delo.si" /> began after a depiction of [[Mary of Help of Brezje]] holding a [[rat]] instead of [[Jesus Christ|Jesus]] was published by the [[Slovenia]]n [[music group]] [[Strelnikoff]] on the cover of their 1998 [[studio album]] ''Bitchcraft.'' The album was made in protest of the official views of the [[Roman Catholic Church]] in Slovenia and the statements of some of its highest representatives on the subject of [[abortion]].<ref name="Delo.si">{{cite news |url=http://www.delo.si/kultura/dediscina/kako-hitro-so-uzaljena-verska-custva.html |title=Kako hitro so prizadeta verska čustva |language=Slovenian |trans-title=How Quickly Religious Sentiments Get Hurt |newspaper=Delo.si |date=18 May 2012 |first=Tanja |last=Cirman}}</ref>
The first to condemn this depiction was [[Franc Rode]], who was the [[Bishop of Ljubljana]] at the time. This was followed by general public outcry and expressions of the inappropriateness of the misuse of one of the most known symbols of [[Roman Catholicism in Slovenia|Slovenian Catholicism]]. The [[State Attorney's Office (Slovenia)|State Attorney's Office]] received 3,867 public protests and 1,208 requests for [[indictment]]. These were united in one that was at first rebuffed before the [[Celje District Court]]. However, the state prosecutor Elizabeta Gyorkos filled a complaint.<ref name=komarji>{{sl icon}} [http://www.mladina.si/tednik/200329/clanek/komarji/ Mladina.si - provokatorji množic]. Vanja Pirc. Published on 21 July 2003. Last accessed on 18 October 2006.</ref> The group members also received phone calls and threats.<ref name=komarji /> In August 2003, the indictment was refused by the [[Ljubljana Higher Court]] as well. In accordance with the [[Constitution of Slovenia]] and the [[Slovenian law]], the court concluded that the authors were "tasteless in their artistic project, however they did not surpass the boundary of allowed at all."<ref>{{sl icon}} [http://www.mladina.si/tednik/200339/clanek/kul--glasba_in_cerkev-sebastijan_ozmec/ Mladina: Blasfemija po slovensko]. Sebastijan Ozmec. Published on 29 September 2003. Last accessed 18 October 2006.</ref>

{{Use Indian English|date=June 2015}} {{Use dmy dates|date=June 2015}} {{Infobox film | name = Super Star | image = Super Star DVD Cover.jpg | caption = DVD Cover | director = [[Nagathihalli Chandrashekhar]] | screenplay = [[Upendra (actor)|Upendra]] | writer = Upendra | producer = Hanumantha Inambar | starring = Upendra
[[Keerthi Reddy]] | music = [[Hamsalekha]] | studio = Prince Productions | cinematography = V R Krishna Kumar | released = 2002 | country = India | language = [[Kannada]] | runtime = 130 minutes }} '''''Super Star''''' is a 2002 [[Kannada cinema|Kannada film]] written by [[Upendra (actor)|Upendra]] and directed by [[Nagathihalli Chandrashekhar]], starring [[Upendra (actor)|Upendra]] and [[Keerthi Reddy]]. The story line was loosely based on the [[Nepalese royal massacre]] involving [[Dipendra of Nepal]], the tragedy that struck the family of the Nepal king. [[Nagathihalli Chandrashekhar]] had mentioned in an interview that, although he was credited as the director, he was not given much freedom on the sets and [[Upendra (actor)|Upendra]] was the one who directed most of the movie. The film had four climaxes that viewers could select on their own. It was dubbed into [[Telugu language|Telugu]] as ''Stupid'', which was surprisingly a lot more successful than the Kannada version.{{cite web|url=http://www.meetelugu.com/movies/movies/card/Stupid%20Movie%20DVD%20Online.html |title=Stupid Movie DVD Online | Telugu Movies | Online Movies |publisher=MeeTelugu.com |date= |accessdate=2012-07-11}} ==Cast== * [[Upendra (actor)|Upendra]] as [[Dipendra of Nepal]] / rock star Ricky * [[Keerthi Reddy]] as [[Devyani Rana]] ==Sound Track== The music for the movie was composed and by [[Hamsalekha]]. The lyrics were penned by [[Upendra (actor)|Upendra]]. The track named Thagole Thagole was a chartbuster. {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Title !! Singers |- | Bhakra bhakra || [[Hemanth Kumar]], [[Shweta Malviya]] |- | Rajkumar Rajkumar || [[Hariharan (singer)|Hariharan]] |- | Thagole Thagole || [[Shankar Mahadevan]] |- | Antu Antu || [[Nanditha]], [[Sonu Nigam]] |- | Thumba Thumba || [[Hariharan (singer)|Hariharan]] |- | Problem || [[Hemanth Kumar]] |- | Bittaku Bittaku || [[Adnan Sami]] & Humming by Shweta Malviya |} ==Critical reception== The reaction from the critics turned out to be mostly negative upon the film's release. While the performances of the lead artistes, unique story line of the film, soundtrack, background music and other technical aspects of the film were praised, the screenplay of the film was the most criticized by the critics as well as the audiences. ==Box office== ===Karnataka=== ''Superstar'' had an extremely strong opening at the box office across [[Karnataka]] similar to the earlier record breaking openers of [[Upendra (actor)|Upendra]] and set the box office on fire during its opening weekend. The film continued to storm the box office during its initial weeks, but failed to live up to the expectations and most of the fans were disappointed by the movie. ''Superstar'' ended up becoming a below average grosser in [[Karnataka]] by running only for 6 weeks in its main centre in [[Bangalore]]. The film was sold to distributors at a very high distribution price and got an extraordinary opening in its initial weeks, thus returning investment for the producer. Compared to Upendra's earlier blockbuster movies like ''[[A (1998 Kannada film)|A]]'', ''[[Upendra (film)|Upendra]]'', ''[[Preethse]]'', ''[[H2O (2002 Indian film)|H2O]]'', this film was considered as average hit as it returned investment for the producer. ===Andhra Pradesh=== The [[Telugu language|Telugu]] version of ''Superstar'' which was released in [[Andhra Pradesh]] in 2003 (a year after its original [[Kannada]] release) was titled as '''''Stupid - O Pichi Vadi Prema Katha''''' and had a fantastic opening across [[Andhra Pradesh]], owing mainly to [[Upendra (actor)|Upendra]]'s loyal Telugu fan following which he had gained due to the large success of the [[Telugu language|Telugu]] versions of his earlier blockbuster movies like ''[[A (1998 Kannada film)|A]]'' and ''[[Upendra (film)]]'' which not only starred him but were also directed by him, and a few straight Telugu movies like ''[[Raa (film)|Raa]]'' and ''[[Kanyadanam (1998 film)|Kanyadanam]]'' which were box office hits. Although ''Superstar'' was just an average grosser in [[Karnataka]], ''Stupid'' surprisingly turned out to be a hit in [[Andhra Pradesh]] by completing 100 days of run and its distributors in Andhra Pradesh earned fair profits from the movie. ==See also== *[[Nepalese royal massacre]] *[[Dipendra of Nepal]] *[[Devyani Rana]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{Nagathihalli Chandrashekhar}} [[Category:Films set in India]] [[Category:Indian films]] [[Category:2002 films]] [[Category:2000s Kannada-language films]] [[Category:Films scored by Hamsalekha]] [[Category:Films based on actual events]] [[Category:Fiction with alternate endings]] [[Category:Kannada-language films dubbed in Telugu]]

page.title: Terrance and Phillip in Not Without My Anus

revision.text:
{{This|the South Park episode produced under the production code 201|the episode with that title|201 (South Park)}} {{good article}} {{Infobox television episode | title = Terrance and Phillip in Not Without My Anus | series = South Park | image = | caption = | season = 2 | episode = 1 | airdate = April 1, 1998 | production = 201 | director = [[Trey Parker]] | writer = Trisha Nixon
Trey Parker
[[Matt Stone]] | season_article = South Park (season 2) | episode_list = List of South Park episodes | prev = [[Cartman's Mom Is a Dirty Slut]] | next = [[Cartman's Mom Is Still a Dirty Slut]] }} "'''Terrance and Phillip in Not Without My Anus'''" is the [[South Park (season 2)|second season]] premiere of the American [[animated television series]] ''[[South Park]]''. The 14th episode of the series overall, it originally aired on [[Comedy Central]] in the United States on April 1, 1998. The episode follows the two [[List of recurring South Park characters#Terrance and Phillip|title characters]], a duo of Canadians who attempt to save their country from the dictator [[Saddam Hussein]] while performing repetitive [[toilet humour]]. Unbeknown to them, the plan was partially set up by their rival, [[List of recurring South Park characters#Scott the Dick|Scott]], a critic who is often displeased by their random jokes of [[flatulence]]. The script was written by series co-creators [[Trey Parker]] and [[Matt Stone]], along with writer Trisha Nixon. The episode was an [[April Fools' Day]] prank on ''South Park'' fans who were waiting to learn the identity of [[Eric Cartman|Cartman]]'s father after the cliffhanger ending of the [[South Park (season 1)|first season]] finale "[[Cartman's Mom Is a Dirty Slut]]". The prank angered viewers resulting in 2,000 e-mail complaints to Comedy Central within a week of the original broadcast. The broadcast date of the subsequent episode, "[[Cartman's Mom Is Still a Dirty Slut]]", was moved up in response to the complaints. "Terrance and Phillip in Not Without My Anus" received generally mixed reviews, with some commentators criticizing Parker and Stone for "duping" their viewers, and others praising them for taking the risk. The creators cited this episode as their favorite and response to it has become warmer since. ==Plot== The episode begins with an announcement that viewers have waited for weeks for the answer to the mystery "[[Cartman's Mom Is a Dirty Slut|Who Is Cartman's Father]]" but then points out that the answer will not be revealed in this episode; instead there is a presentation of a stand-alone cartoon titled ''Not Without My Anus'' starring [[List of recurring South Park characters|Terrance and Phillip]]. A caption wishes the viewers a Happy [[April Fools' Day]]. The cartoon itself opens in a courtroom in [[Canada]] with Terrance on trial for the murder of a local doctor; Phillip is his lawyer while Terrance and Phillip's sworn nemesis Scott, who has had a long hatred of the duo's [[toilet humor]], is acting as the prosecutor. Scott uses a group of seemingly airtight exhibits to prove Terrance's guilt, while Terrance's defense consists of nothing but a long string of fart jokes. Ultimately, the jury returns a verdict of not guilty. Angered, Scott promises vengeance. He is ultimately approached by [[Iraq]]i dictator [[Saddam Hussein]], proposing a deal: Saddam would assist in getting Terrance and Phillip out of Canada, in exchange for Scott assisting Saddam and his Iraqi associates into Canada. Scott is apprehensive about trusting Saddam, but agrees to the deal. The pair then conspires to kidnap Sally, daughter of Terrance and [[Celine Dion]], and hold her hostage, as bait to lure Terrance and Phillip to [[Tehran]]; Saddam's soldiers would then murder Terrance and Phillip on arrival. Terrance and Phillip become aware of the kidnapping when they receive a letter, but they immediately locate Sally upon arrival in Tehran. The duo return Sally to her home, where Saddam has now taken control. Celine, Terrance's now ex-wife, is dating, and has become pregnant by a friend of the duo named Ugly Bob. While the couple discuss their relationship, Saddam interrupts and takes them hostage, with Celine having planned to sing at a [[Canadian football]] game. Scott has also become worried about the presence of the Iraqi soldiers in Canada, but becomes infuriated when he finds that Terrance and Phillip have returned to Canada safely. He confronts Saddam about the double-cross, but Saddam's armed guards scare him into backing away. It is revealed that Saddam is trying to take over Canada as the first step in a plan for world domination. Terrance and Phillip arrive at the game. Instead of following a plan set up by Scott to commit suicide by using a bomb, they come up with a new plan and put on gas masks. With brute force, everyone farts a huge gas cloud which kills Saddam and his soldiers. Scott arrives and is annoyed to find that Terrance and Phillip are still alive. Terrance, Phillip, Celine and everyone else (excluding Scott) celebrate their freedom with a rendition of "[[O Canada]]". During the credits, an announcement is shown stating that the solution to who Cartman's father is will be answered in a few weeks. ==Production== [[File:Trey Parker Matt Stone 2007.jpg|thumb|left|alt=Two adult males sitting in chairs; the male to the right is speaking into a handheld microphone|Series co-creators Parker (left) and Stone co-wrote "Not Without my Anus".]] "Terrance and Philip in Not Without My Anus" was written by Trisha Nixon and ''South Park'' co-creators [[Trey Parker]] and [[Matt Stone]], and directed by Parker. It was the [[List of South Park episodes#Season 2: 1998.E2.80.931999|second season]] premiere and first episode centered completely around Terrance and Phillip, fictional cartoon characters within the series.{{Cite news |last=Bayer |first=Jakob Von |title= Canada, as seen on TV: With The Simpsons coming to Toronto, we revisit some of our other starring roles |publisher=[[National Post]] |date=2002-02-09 |page=SP4}}{{Cite news |last=Casimir |first=Jon |publisher=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |date=1998-08-31 |page=15}} The episode first aired on April 1, 1998 as an [[April Fools' Day]] prank by Parker and Stone on ''South Park'' fans who were anxiously waiting to learn the identity of [[Eric Cartman|Cartman]]'s father after the [[cliffhanger]] ending of "[[Cartman's Mom Is a Dirty Slut]]", the [[South Park (season 1)|first season]] finale. Instead, Parker and Stone presented an episode entirely focused on a Terrance and Phillip cartoon with nothing in the story about Cartman's father.{{Cite news |last=Idato |first=Michael |publisher=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |date=2002-08-19 |page=24}} Upset fans wrote more than 2,000 angry e-mail complaints to [[Comedy Central]] within a week of the episode's original broadcast,{{Cite news |last=Feran |first=Tom |title="Tom Jones" big, bawdy, well done |date=1998-04-04 |work=[[The Plain Dealer]] |location=[[Cleveland, Ohio]] |page=1F}} and media outlets said some fans harbored a grudge against the show more than five years after the episode was broadcast.{{Cite news |last=Clodfelter |first=Tim |title=Lots of fun some Comedy Central shows make it to DVD |work=[[Winston-Salem Journal]] |date=2003-07-04 |page=E4}} Stone said to ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' in response to the fan backlash, "If you get that pissed off because you don't know who a little construction paper kid's father is, then there's really something wrong with you."{{Cite news |last=Bickley |first=Claire |title=The television year in months; hello to CablePulse24, Goodbye to Seinfeld and have a good thought for Michael J. Fox |work=[[Toronto Sun]] |date=1998-12-26 |page=137}}{{Cite news |last=Low |first=Bob |title=The Net; Web goes toon barmy; Bob Low surfs the Net |work=[[Daily Record (Scotland)|Daily Record]] |location=[[Glasgow]], [[Scotland]] |date=1998-04-17 |page=43}}{{Cite news |last=Johnson |first=Allan |title=On his first CD, "Raging Bully", Bobby Slayton takes no prionsers |work=[[Chicago Tribune]] |date=1998-04-17 |page=10}} Allan Johnson of the ''[[Chicago Tribune]]'' said Comedy Central was "punking out" with the decision. Several reviewers noted a significant amount of crude and vulgar humor in "Terrance and Philip in Not Without My Anus", even by ''South Park'' standards; ''[[The Sydney Morning Herald]]'' noted the episode contained 29 separate fart jokes in the span of 22 minutes. [[Global Television Network]] in Canada reported no complaints about the episode in the weeks after its release.{{Cite news |last=Bickley |first=Claire |title=Jerry strikes out pitch to book Skydome for Seinfeld bash nixed |work=[[Toronto Sun]] |date=1998-04-21 |page=62}} ==Reception== Reviewers were mixed on Parker and Stone's elaborate April Fools' Day prank. Diane Werts of ''[[Newsday]]'' said of the episode, "Fans rioted. Some jumped ship and never came back. The lesson: Pay off our expectations, or you'll be sorry."{{Cite news |last=Werts |first=Diane |title=Do viewers need closure after canceled show's cliffhanger? |work=[[South Florida Sun-Sentinel]] |date=2000-07-13 |location=[[Fort Lauderdale, Florida]] |page=3E}} Jim Minge of the ''[[Omaha World-Herald]]'' said ''South Park'' fans were "duped" by the episode.{{Cite news |last=Minge |first=Jim |title=One rumor is for real: Foo Fighters will perform at Westfair |date=1998-04-09 |work=[[Omaha World-Herald]] |page=46}} Philip Martin of the ''[[Arkansas Democrat-Gazette]]'', who said in May 1998 the ''South Park'' phenomenon was "dead", described the April Fools' prank as "lamentable" and part of the reason for the show's apparent decline.{{Cite news |last=Martin |first=Philip |title=On the American trash heap; Like South Park, pop culture wasn't built to last |work=[[Arkansas Democrat-Gazette]] |date=1998-05-10 |page=E1}} Others, however, praised Parker and Stone for making the move at the risk of upsetting fans. Tim Clodfelter of the ''[[Winston-Salem Journal]]'' said, "It was a funny, clever move [that] quickly separated the fans who truly "got" [Parker and Stone's] humor from those who were just watching for the dirty jokes." Jon Casimir of ''The Sydney Morning Herald'' said, "It is gratifying, in an entertainment world dominated by market research and common denominators, to see a program that obviously doesn't care if you like it or not." However, he said the characterization of Terrance and Phillip was too thin to be particularly funny, and added that the novelty of the prank is lost in later years. Jakob Von Bayer said the episode continued a long history of ''South Park'' Canada-bashing: "South Park has gotten a lot of comic mileage out of Canada over the years. [...] This episode portrays a country full of [[Bob and Doug McKenzie]]s; [[Toronto]] is but a highway town en route to [[Buffalo, New York|Buffalo]]." "Terrance and Philip in Not Without My Anus" was among the episodes featured in a 2006 list by the ''[[Winnipeg Free Press]]'' of the ten most memorable ''South Park'' episodes.{{Cite news|title=Politically incorrect comedy, heeeeerrre!|work=[[Winnipeg Free Press]]|location=[[Canada]]|date=2006-11-19|page=D5}} The ''[[Toronto Sun]]'' listed the episode as one of the most memorable television moments of 1998, and the single most memorable moment from the month of April. The prank played by the airing of this episode was revisited a number of times in subsequent episodes. The episode "[[Cartoon Wars Part II]]" revisits it by appearing to begin with a similar spoof, though the episode then cuts to the actual plot. The [[List of South Park episodes#Season 5: 2001|fifth season]] episode, "[[Terrance and Phillip: Behind the Blow]]", also references the controversy over the airing of this episode,{{cite book |title=Drawn to Television Prime-time Animation from the Flintstones |last= Booker |first=M. Keith |year=2006 |publisher=[[Greenwood Publishing Group|Praeger Publishers]] |location=[[Westport, Connecticut]] |isbn= 0-275-99019-2 |page=140}} as does the thirteenth season episode, "[[Eat, Pray, Queef]]".{{Cite news |last=Lynch |first=Kelvin |title=Laugh of the day: Martha Stewart does a good thing for spring |date=2009-04-02 |work=The Philadelphia Examiner}} ===Media release=== "Terrance and Phillip in Not Without My Anus" was released on [[VHS]] on June 15, 1999, as a stand-alone episode.{{Cite news |title= No Foolin'! Terrance & Phillip Episode, Aired Only Once on Television, Becomes Available on Video June 15 |date=1999-06-11 |work=[[Business Wire]] |location=[[Burbank, California]]}} It was also released on DVD, along with the rest of season two, in June 2003. ==References== {{Reflist|2}} ==External links== {{Wikiquote|South_Park/Season_2#Terrance_and_Phillip_in_Not_Without_My_Anus_.282.01.29|Terrance and Phillip in Not Without My Anus}} * [http://www.southparkstudios.com/full-episodes/s02e01-not-without-my-anus "Terrance and Phillip in Not Without My Anus"] Full episode at South Park Studios * {{imdb episode|0757027}} * {{tv.com episode|south-park/terrance-and-phillip-in-not-without-my-anus-2430}} {{South Park episodes|2}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Terrance And Phillip In Not Without My Anus}} [[Category:1998 American television episodes]] [[Category:April Fools' Day]] [[Category:Celine Dion]] [[Category:Cultural depictions of Saddam Hussein]] [[Category:Fictional television shows]] [[Category:South Park (season 2) episodes]] [[Category:Television episodes set in Canada]]

{{italic title}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2016}} [[File:Bragolin Crying Boy.JPG|thumb|upright=1.1|The artist's signature ''G Bragolin'' is present in the top-right corner]] '''''The Crying Boy''''' is a [[mass production|mass-produced]] print of a painting by [[Italy|Italian]] painter [[Giovanni Bragolin]].<ref name="Polidoro2012">Polidoro, Massimo (November/December 2012), "Curse That Painting!", ''Skeptical Inquirer'' '''36''' (6): 17–19</ref> It was widely distributed from the 1950s onwards.
There are numerous alternative versions, all portraits of tearful young boys or girls.<ref name="Polidoro2012" /> In addition to being widely known, certain [[urban legend|urban legends]] attribute a "curse" to the painting.
==Curse== On 5 September 1985, the British [[Tabloid (newspaper format)|tabloid]] newspaper ''[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]'' reported that an Essex [[firefighter]] claimed that undamaged copies of the painting were frequently found amidst the ruins of burned houses.<ref name="Polidoro2012" /> By the end of November, belief in the painting's curse was widespread enough that ''The Sun'' was organising mass [[bonfire]]s of the paintings, sent in by readers.<ref name="sun-2010">Steve Punt, "Solved: Curse of the Crying Boy; Comic’s Obsession with Painting", The Sun, 9 October 2010, p.8.</ref>
[[Steve Punt]], a British writer and comedian, investigated the curse of the crying boy in a [[BBC Radio 4]] production called ''[[Punt PI]]''. Although the format of the programmes are comic in nature, Punt researched the history of the Crying Boy painting.<ref>''[[Punt PI]],'' [http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/b00v697r Crying Boy episode] (programme broadcast Sat 9 Oct 2010, BBC Radio 4)</ref> The conclusion reached by the programme, following testing at the [[Building Research Establishment]], is that the prints were treated with a [[varnish]] containing [[fire retardant]], and that the string holding the painting to the wall would be the first to deteriorate, resulting in the painting landing face down on the floor and thus being protected, although no explanation was given as to why no other paintings were turning up unscathed. The picture was also mentioned in an episode about curses in the TV series ''[[Weird or What?]]'' in 2012.<ref>[http://www.syfy.com/weirdorwhat/episodes/season/2/episode/204/curses Curses in Weird or What?] on [[SyFy]]</ref>
==See also== * ''[[The Hands Resist Him]]'', also known as ''The eBay Haunted Painting''

{{Multiple issues|{{copy edit|date=October 2018}}{{underlinked|date=October 2018}}{{overly detailed|date=October 2018}}}}
{{Infobox music festival | name = | image = | image_size = | alt = | caption = | genre = Gospel | dates = | location = Tafawa Balewa Square | coordinates = | years_active = 2006 - present | founders = [[Paul Adefarasin]] | attendance = 700,000 {{small|(2017)}} | capacity = | website = {{URL|http://theexperiencelagos.com}} }} '''The Experience''' (commonly referred to as '''The Experience Lagos''') is an annual free gospel music [[concert]] held at the [[Tafawa Balewa Square]], located in Lagos Island, [[Nigeria]]. It was founded by [[Paul Adefarasin]], the lead pastor of House On The Rock, in 2016 with an attendance of 70,000 people. Adefarasin hosts the concert each year.<ref name=":0">{{Cite news|url=https://believersportal.com/history-experience-lagos/|title=History Of The Experience, Lagos {{!}} Believers Portal|date=2016-11-15|work=Believers Portal|access-date=2018-10-10|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.pulse.ng/communities/religion/everything-you-probably-dont-know-about-the-experience-2017-id7684705.html|title=Everything you probably don't know about The Experience 2017|last=Udodiong|first=Inemesit|access-date=2018-10-10|language=en-US}}</ref><ref name=":1">{{Cite news|url=https://www.vanguardngr.com/2017/12/experience-lagos-changing-perspectives-africa/|title=How The Experience Lagos is changing perspectives of Africa - Vanguard News|date=2017-12-15|work=Vanguard News|access-date=2018-10-10|language=en-US}}</ref>
The event regularly features local and international artists such as [[Kirk Franklin]], [[CeCe Winans]], [[Donnie McClurkin]], [[Don Moen]], [[Frank Edwards (gospel musician)|Frank Edwards]], Nathaniel Bassey, and Chioma Jesus. The Experience is recognised as one of the largest music events in [[Africa]].<ref name=":1" /><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.businessdayonline.com/news/article/economic-side-experience-lagos-2017/|title=The economic side of ‘The Experience Lagos 2017’|last=|first=|date=December 17, 2017|work=BusinessDay|access-date=October 10, 2018}}</ref>
== History == The Experience held for the first time in 1 December 2006 at the Tafawa Balewa Square with 70,000 people in attendance, and featured Kirk Franklin, [[Israel Houghton]], Donnie McClurkin, Lionel Peterson, Jamal Bryant, Mike Aremu, Dunni Olanrewaju, Dc Envoys, Gordons, Asu Ekiye, Buchi, Tosin Martins, and Midnight Crew.<ref name=":0" /><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.thisdaylive.com/index.php/2016/12/31/the-legacy-called-the-experience/|title=The Legacy called The Experience - THISDAYLIVE|date=2016-12-31|work=THISDAYLIVE|access-date=2018-10-10|language=en-US}}</ref>
=== 2007 - 2009 === 2007 was the only year when The Experience did not hold in December; the concert was instead moved to 30 November. The musical performance was provided by Kirk Franklin, Israel Houghton, and Lionel Peterson.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://allafrica.com/stories/200711260921.html|title=Nigeria: Organisers Promise Maximum Security At the Experience Concert|last=Amadi|first=Ogbonna|date=November 24, 2007|website=AllAfrica|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=October 10, 2018}}</ref>
The Experience held on the 5 December 2008 at the Tafawa Balewa Square. It featured Kirk Franklin, Donnie McClurkin, Don Moen, Fred Hammond, Kurt Carr, Chevelle Franklyn, Mary Mary, Muyiwa Olarewaju, ‘Dekunle Fuji and Midnight Crew.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.loopjamaica.com/content/chevelle-franklyn-perfrom-largest-gospel-concert-world|title=Chevelle Franklyn to perform at 'largest gospel concert in the world'|website=www.loopjamaica.com|language=en|access-date=2018-10-21}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://allafrica.com/stories/200812150651.html|title=Nigeria: Lagos - the Experience of an All Night Explosion|last=Sowoolu|first=Lolade|date=December 13, 2008|website=AllAfrica|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=October 21, 2018}}</ref>
The 4th edition of The Experience held on the 4 December 2009, featuring music by Lara George, Sammie Okposo, Don Moen, Gordons, Timi Dakolo, Chevelle Franklin, Donnie Mc Cluckin, Mike Aremu, Nikki Laoye, Rooftop MCs, Ron Kenoly, Bebe and Cece Winans and Kirk Franklin.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://allafrica.com/stories/200912150752.html|title=Nigeria: The Experience That Rocked Lagos|last=Olusina|first=Olaolu|date=December 14, 2009|website=AllAfrica|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=October 21, 2018}}</ref>
=== 2010 - 2012 === The Experience held on the 3 December 2010 and featured Panam Percy Paul, Fred Hammond, Phil Driscoll, Judy Jacob, Don Moen, Papa San, Mary Mary, Mike Aremu, Sammy Okposo, Micah Stampley, Israel Houghton, and Chevelle Franklyn. [[Goodluck Jonathan]], Nigeria’s former President, and [[Babatunde Fashola]], Lagos’ former Governor, were in attendance.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://olorisupergal.com/2010/11/25/the-experience-lagos/|title=THE EXPERIENCE LAGOS. - Olori Supergal|date=2010-11-25|work=Olori Supergal|access-date=2018-10-21|language=en-US}}</ref>
2011 marked the first and only time The Experience was not held at the Tafawa Balewa Square. The concert was moved to the Expo Center of [[Eko Hotels and Suites]] and lasted from 5 pm on 2 December to 1 am the next day. The Experience regular Don Moen, including acts Chevelle Franklyn, Micah Stampley and Kirk Franklin headlined the year’s performance. Also unique to the 2011 event was the requirement of a free ticket for attendance.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.lgtnigeria.com/viewGeneralListing_page.php?date=2011-11-07%2017:59:39|title=House on the Rock Presents: The Experience 2011|last=Boham|first=Dienye|work=LGTNigeria|access-date=2018-10-21}}</ref>
The 7th edition of The Experience held on the 7 December 2012 with a lineup of Don Moen, Israel Houghton, Fred Hammond, Micah Stampley, Chevelle Franklin, Deitrick Haddon, Timi Dakolo and the Soweto Spiritual Singers. Notable figures such as [[Yakubu Gowon]], Tonye Cole, Olusegun Mimiko, Wale Adefarasin, Emmanuella Abimbola Fashola and Sam Adeyemi were in attendance.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://connectnigeria.com/articles/2012/11/get-ready-for-the-experience-2012/|title=The biggest Gospel event on Earth, The Experience is back for 2012! • Connect Nigeria|website=connectnigeria.com|language=en-GB|access-date=2018-10-21}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.christianmediang.com/2012/11/countdown-to-experience-2012-7-december.html|title=Countdown to The Experience 2012 - 7 December 2012, TBS Lagos|website=www.christianmediang.com|access-date=2018-10-21}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.konnectafrica.net/great-photos-from-the-experience-lagos-2012-event/|title=Great Photos from The Experience Lagos 2012 Event|date=2012-12-24|work=Konnect Africa|access-date=2018-10-21|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://zoemagazine.wordpress.com/2012/12/11/zjolt-review-the-experience-lagos-2012-in-pictures/|title=Zjolt Review: THE EXPERIENCE LAGOS 2012 IN PICTURES|date=2012-12-10|work=Zjolt™|access-date=2018-10-21|language=en-US}}</ref>
=== 2013 - 2015 === The 2013 concert featured the performance of Don Moen, Donnie McClurkin, Yolanda Adams, Tye Tribbett, Israel Houghton, Cece Winans, Micah Stampley, Eben, Frank Edwards, Midnite Crew, Freke on December 6.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://thenet.ng/don-moen-donnie-mcclurkin-yolanda-adams-cece-winans-others-for-the-experience-2013/|title=Don Moen, Donnie McClurkin, Yolanda Adams, Cece Winans, others for The Experience 2013 - Nigerian Entertainment Today|date=2013-11-07|work=Nigerian Entertainment Today|access-date=2018-10-21|language=en-GB}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.lindaikejisblog.com/2013/12/the-experience-lagos-2013.html|title=The Experience Lagos 2013|website=Linda Ikeji's Blog|language=en-GB|access-date=2018-10-21}}</ref>
Over 600,000 people attended the 2014 concert on 5 December, with Donnie McClurkin, Israel Houghton, Chevelle Franklin, Micah Stampley, Midnight Crew, Freke Umoh and Frank Edwards, Sinach, Nathaniel Bassey, Angella Christie, Onos Ariyo and Chioma Jesus performing.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://thenet.ng/the-experience-2014-holds-tomorrow/|title=THE EXPERIENCE 2014 holds tomorrow - Nigerian Entertainment Today|date=2014-12-04|work=Nigerian Entertainment Today|access-date=2018-10-21|language=en-GB}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.pulse.ng/lifestyle/events/the-experience-2014-the-biggest-gospel-concert-to-hold-today-id3326427.html|title=The Experience 2014: The biggest gospel concert to hold today|last=Adiele|first=Chinedu|access-date=2018-10-21|language=en-US}}</ref> Notable figures such as [[Jimi Agbaje]], [[Abimbola Fashola]] and [[Femi Fani-Kayode]] attended the concert.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bellanaija.com/2014/12/an-experience-to-remember-over-600-000-people-attended-the-experience-lagos-2014-event/|title=An Experience to Remember! Over 600,000 People Attended ‘The Experience’ Lagos 2014 Event - BellaNaija|website=www.bellanaija.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-10-21}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.pulse.ng/communities/religion/photos-moments-from-experience-2014-id3331300.html|title=Photos: Moments from Experience 2014|last=Dede|first=Steve|access-date=2018-10-21|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.vanguardngr.com/2014/12/experience-2014-don-moen-adefarasin-odukoya-others-make-case-divine-restoration-nigeria/|title=Experience 2014: Don Moen, Adefarasin, Odukoya, others make case for divine restoration in Nigeria - Vanguard News|date=2014-12-06|work=Vanguard News|access-date=2018-10-21|language=en-US}}</ref>
On December 4, 2015, Paul Adefarasin led a press conference at the Eko Hotels and Suites to kickstart the year’s concert that would be taken place later that day.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.pulse.ng/lifestyle/events/the-experience-2015-paul-adefarasin-don-meon-donnie-mcclurkin-micah-stampey-chioma-jesus-sammie-okposo-others-attend-press-conference-id4425589.html|title=The Experience 2015: Paul Adefarasin, Don Meon, Donnie McClurkin, Micah Stampey, Chioma Jesus, Sammie Okposo others attend Press conference|last=Adiele|first=Chinedu|access-date=2018-10-21|language=en-US}}</ref> The musical performance was by Don Moen, Fred Hammond, Frank Edwards, Donnie McClurkin, Hezekiah Walker, Kim Burrell, Jessica Reedy, Sonnie Badu, Chioma Jesus, Nathaniel Bassey, Sammie Okposo, Midnight Crew, Micah Stampley, Julius Nglass and the Lagos City Chorale. Unlike the previous one-day events, 2015 marked the first time additional dates were included in the concert; two other dates, December 12 and 15, were added. Over 700,000 people attended.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bellanaija.com/2015/11/the-experience-lagos-is-back-with-10th-edition-join-don-moen-fred-hammond-frand-edwards-more-for-a-night-of-praise-this-december/|title='The Experience Lagos' is back with the 10th Edition! Join Don Moen, Fred Hammond, Frank Edwards & More for a Night of Praise this December - BellaNaija|website=www.bellanaija.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-10-21}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://guardian.ng/news/the-experience-and-the-of-love-worship/|title=The Experience and the love of worship|access-date=2018-10-21|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://gospotainment.com/the-experience-lagos-2015-the-countdown-is-on/|title=The Experience Lagos 2015; the countdown is on. {{!}} Gospotainment.com|website=gospotainment.com|language=en-US|access-date=2018-10-21}}</ref>
=== 2016 - present === The 2016 event held on 2 December and saw a gathering of 700,000 with performances from Don Moen, Travis Greene, Donnie McClurkin, Tope Alabi, Tim Godfrey, Segun Obe, Samsong, Onos Ariyo, Gabriel Eziashi, Frank Edwards, Smokie Norful, Micah Stampley, Eno Michael, Chioma Jesus. Nigeria’s Vice President [[Yemi Osinbajo]] and his wife Oludolapo Osinbajo attended the concert. Also present were celebrities [[Don Jazzy]], [[Tiwa Savage]], [[Dr SID]], [[Toke Makinwa]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.vanguardngr.com/2016/11/pastor-paul-adefarasin-experience-2016/|title=Pastor Paul Adefarasin and The Experience 2016 - Vanguard News|date=2016-11-17|work=Vanguard News|access-date=2018-10-21|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.pulse.ng/communities/religion/the-experience-10-most-amazing-performances-from-the-2016-edition-id5855497.html|title=The Experience: 10 most amazing performances from the 2016 edition|last=Udodiong|first=Inemesit|access-date=2018-10-21|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.vanguardngr.com/2016/12/experience-2016-worshipers-turn-recession-redemption-lagos/|title=Experience 2016: Worshipers turn recession to redemption in Lagos - Vanguard News|date=2016-12-11|work=Vanguard News|access-date=2018-10-21|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://sunnewsonline.com/don-moen-frank-edwards-others-dazzle-at-the-experience-2016/|title=Don Moen, Frank Edwards, others dazzle at The Experience 2016 – The Sun Nigeria|date=2016-12-09|work=The Sun Nigeria|access-date=2018-10-21|language=en-US}}</ref>
In 2017, The Experience held on December 1. Victor Adeyemi of Global Harvest Church delivered an opening prayer at the event. The musical performance was by Tim Godfrey, Nathaniel Bassey, Chioma Jesus, Don Moen, Donnie McClurkin, Midnight Crew, Travis Greene, Tope Alabi, Frank Edwards, Sonnie Badu, Beejay Sax, Onos Ariyo, Eben, Micah Stampley and Kingsley “KaeStrings” Innocent. The 2017 concert had an attendance of over 700,000 people.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.pulse.ng/lifestyle/events/don-moen-travis-greene-to-headline-the-experience-2017-id7658214.html|title=Don Moen, Travis Greene to headline The Experience 2017|last=Adesanya|first=Adedayo|access-date=2018-10-21|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.pulse.ng/communities/religion/everything-you-probably-dont-know-about-the-experience-2017-id7684705.html|title=Everything you probably don't know about The Experience 2017|last=Udodiong|first=Inemesit|access-date=2018-10-21|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.vanguardngr.com/2017/11/don-moen-mcclurkin-travis-greene-others-experience-2017/|title=Don Moen, McClurkin, Travis Greene, others for Experience 2017 - Vanguard News|date=2017-11-12|work=Vanguard News|access-date=2018-10-21|language=en-US}}</ref>
Also present at the 2017 event was [[Akinwunmi Ambode]], the Governor of Lagos. Adefarasin presented the Governor with a certificate of having built 100 school laboratories.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.vanguardngr.com/2017/12/ambode-experience-hails-adefarasin-humanitarian-interventions/|title=Ambode at Experience, hails Adefarasin for humanitarian interventions - Vanguard News|date=2017-12-02|work=Vanguard News|access-date=2018-10-21|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://governor.lagosstate.gov.ng/2017/12/01/the-2017-edition-of-the-experience/|title=THE 2017 EDITION OF THE EXPERIENCE – Akinwunmi Ambode – Governor of Lagos State|website=governor.lagosstate.gov.ng|language=en-US|access-date=2018-10-21}}</ref>
== Location == Asides from 2011 when the concert was held at Eko Hotels and Suites, The Experience has held at the Tafawa Balewa Square every year. The square, which usually has a capacity for 50,000 people, is fitted with extra seating to accommodate the event's large crowd.<ref name=":1" /><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.yamahaproaudio.com/global/en/news_events/newsrelease/2015/0416_10_subfrantic.jsp|title=Yamaha Experiences Africa’s Largest Live Concert With Subfrantic|last=|first=|date=|website=www.yamahaproaudio.com|language=en|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-10-21}}</ref>
=== Traffic and security === Due to the central location of Tafawa Balewa Square, The Experience usually results in above average traffic conditions. A force made up of the [[Lagos State Traffic Management (LASTMA)]] and the [[Nigeria Police Force]] is deployed to ease traffic flow each year.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.pulse.ng/news/business/traffic-update-the-experience-2015-shuts-down-lagos-state-id4427436.html|title=Traffic Update: The Experience 2015 shuts down Lagos state!|last=Udodiong|first=Inemesit|access-date=2018-10-21|language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://happenings.com.ng/the-experience-brings-lagos-to-a-stand-still/|title='The Experience' brings Lagos to a stand still - Online Entertainment and Lifestyle Magazine in Nigeria|date=2014-12-05|work=Online Entertainment and Lifestyle Magazine in Nigeria|access-date=2018-10-21|language=en-US}}</ref><ref name=":0" />
The police, Rapid Response Squad, Anti-Bomb Squad and private security agents are usually present at each event to provide additional security.<ref name=":0" />

{{hatnote|For the film adaptation, see [[The Unsinkable Molly Brown (film)]]}} {{Infobox musical |name= The Unsinkable Molly Brown |image= Unsinkable_molly_brown_1960.jpg |caption= Original Broadway Cast Recording CD |music= [[Meredith Willson]] |lyrics= Meredith Willson |book= Richard Morris |basis= |productions= 1960 [[Broadway theater|Broadway]]
1962, 1989 US national tour
2009 [[West End theatre|West End]]
2014 [[Denver]] |awards= }} ''''' The Unsinkable Molly Brown''''' is a 1960 [[musical theater|musical]] with music and lyrics by [[Meredith Willson]] and [[Libretto|book]] by Richard Morris. The plot is a fictionalized account of the life of [[Margaret Brown]], who survived the [[sinking of the RMS Titanic|sinking of the RMS ''Titanic'']], and her wealthy miner-husband. A [[musical film]] version also titled ''[[The Unsinkable Molly Brown (film)|The Unsinkable Molly Brown]]'', with screenplay by [[Helen Deutsch]], was released in 1964. ==Productions== The original [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]] production opened at the [[Winter Garden Theatre]] on November 3, 1960 and closed on February 10, 1962 after 532 performances and 1 preview. It was directed by [[Dore Schary]] and choreographed by [[Peter Gennaro]]. The opening cast included [[Tammy Grimes]], [[Harve Presnell]], and [[Jack Harrold]]. Grimes won the [[Tony Award for Best Performance by a Featured Actress in a Musical]]. Grimes appeared in the US national tour in 1962, including Los Angeles and San Francisco in April and June 1962, respectively.Zolotow, Sam. "Schary To Stage Play About Files", ''The New York Times'', April 2, 1962, p. 26 Presnell reprised his stage role for the 1964 film, also entitled ''[[The Unsinkable Molly Brown (film)|The Unsinkable Molly Brown]]'' starring [[Debbie Reynolds]]. The two starred in a 1989-1990 national tour.Churnin, Nancy.[http://articles.latimes.com/1989-08-25/entertainment/ca-814_1_unsinkable-molly-brown "Stage Review Debbie Reynolds Is Unsinkable in 'Molly Brown'"] ''Los Angeles Times'', August 25, 1989Klein, Alvin.[https://www.nytimes.com/1990/04/01/nyregion/theater-debbie-reynolds-re-creates-molly.html "Debbie Reynolds Re-Creates 'Molly'"] ''The New York Times'', April 1, 1990. The first [[West End theatre|West End]] production, with [[Abi Finley]] and [[Sean Pol McGreevy]] in the leading roles, opened in May 2009.Shenton, Mark.[http://www.thestage.co.uk/reviews/review.php/24559/the-unsinkable-molly-brown "'The Unsinkable Molly Brown' review"] TheStage.co.uk, June 1, 2009. ;Readings A reading of ''Molly Brown'', the first of the revised versions by [[Dick Scanlan]], took place in [[Denver]] at the Denver Center Theatre Company's Colorado New Play Summit in February 2009. The show was directed by [[Kathleen Marshall]] and starred Kerry O'Malley as Molly, [[Marc Kudisch]] as James Joseph "J.J." Brown, William Parry as Horace Tabor, and Linda Mugelston as Polly Pry. The story was revised "to use more elements from the real-life story" of Molly Brown.Jones, Kenneth. [http://www.playbill.com/news/article/125791-OMalley-Is-Molly-Brown-in-Denver-Reading-of-Revised-Musical-Kudisch-Also-Stars "O'Malley Is Molly Brown in Denver Reading of Revised Musical; Kudisch Also Stars"], Playbill.com, January 30, 2009. A reading of the musical was held in May 2010. The show was directed/choreographed by [[Kathleen Marshall]], music supervision by Michael Rafter, with [[Sutton Foster]] as Molly and [[Craig Bierko]] as J.J. Brown. This reading had only Molly and J.J. as characters, cutting out all others that were in the previous version.Jones, Kenneth.[http://www.playbill.com/news/article/139204-EXCLUSIVE-Sutton-Foster-and-Craig-Bierko-to-Star-in-Molly-Brown-Musical-Reading "EXCLUSIVE: Sutton Foster and Craig Bierko to Star in Molly Brown Musical Reading"], Playbill.com, April 30, 2010. In December 2011, another reading of the musical by Scanlan was staged. The creative team was the same as in May 2010, and it starred Foster and Kudisch again, [[Teal Wicks]], [[Francis Jue]] and [[Zachary James]], among others. The score consists of about half from the original musical and "the rest of the "new" score is made up songs from the late Willson's catalog."Jones, Kenneth. [http://www.playbill.com/news/article/158017-Sutton-Foster-and-Marc-Kudisch-Bang-Unsinkable-Molly-Browns-Tub-in-Reading-of-Revised-Musical "Sutton Foster and Marc Kudisch Bang Unsinkable Molly Brown's Tub in Reading of Revised Musical"] {{Webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120630073452/http://www.playbill.com/news/article/158017-Sutton-Foster-and-Marc-Kudisch-Bang-Unsinkable-Molly-Browns-Tub-in-Reading-of-Revised-Musical |date=2012-06-30 }}, Playbill.com, December 27, 2011. Opening September 12, 2014, a full production of the Dick Scanlan revisioning was produced at the [[Denver Center for the Performing Arts]], running through October 26. The production featured Beth Malone and Burke Moses. The plotline differed significantly from the original production, opening with Molly in the ''Titanic'' lifeboat, and then flashing back to follow her life from her first visit to Leadville. The production received favorable reviews from local reviewers and a notice in the ''New York Times'', "A New Crew Salvages Old Molly Brown."{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2014/09/21/theater/a-new-crew-salvages-old-molly-brown.html|title=A New Crew Salvages Old ‘Molly Brown’|first=Cara Joy|last=David|date=17 September 2014|accessdate=22 December 2017|website=Nytimes.com}} ==Plot== In the early 1900s, feisty tomboy Molly Tobin wrestles with her three younger brothers[http://www.mtishows.com/show_detail.asp?showid=000076 "'The Unsinkable Molly Brown' Synopsis"] mtishows.com, accessed August 22, 2011and tells them and her father that she wants to learn to read and write and to find a rich husband ("I Ain't Down Yet"). Molly makes her way to the Saddle Rock saloon in [[Leadville, Colorado]] and applies for a job. On the way to Leadville, Colorado she meets J.J. "Leadville" Johnny Brown, who falls in love with her and promises to give her whatever she wants ("I'll Never Say No"). After they marry, Johnny sells a claim and provides Molly with the money she wants, enough to enter the high social life in Denver ("Beautiful People of Denver"). Molly and Johnny, now dressed in gaudy finery, are made fun of by the Denver society people she wants to impress, and they travel to Europe, against Johnny's better instincts. The couple, and especially Molly, are welcomed and accepted by European royalty, but the attentions of Prince DeLong towards Molly upset Johnny and he returns to Leadville alone. Molly realizes that Johnny is her true love, and she sails for home on the [[RMS Titanic|RMS ''Titanic'']] ("Dolce Far Niente"). As the ''Titanic'' sinks and the tragedy unfolds, Molly survives in one of the lifeboats. She finally is reunited with Johnny, who has built Molly her own "castle," a beautiful home in the [[Rocky Mountains]]. ==Musical numbers== {{col-begin}} {{col-2}} ;Act I *Overture -- Orchestra *I Ain't Down Yet -- Molly Tobin and Her Brothers *Belly Up to the Bar, Boys -- Molly Tobin, Christmas Morgan and the Miners *I've A'ready Started In -- Johnny "Leadville" Brown, Christmas Morgan, Charlie, Burt and Gitter *I'll Never Say No -- Johnny "Leadville" Brown *My Own Brass Bed -- Molly Tobin *The Denver Police -- Three Policemen *Beautiful People of Denver -- Molly Tobin *Are You Sure? -- Molly Tobin, Monsignor Ryan and Guests *I Ain't Down Yet (Reprise)-- Molly Tobin and Johnny "Leadville" Brown {{col-break}} ;Act II *Happy Birthday, Mrs. J. J. Brown -- Princess DeLong, Prince DeLong and the International set *Bon Jour (The Language Song) -- Molly Tobin, Prince DeLong and the International set *If I Knew -- Johnny "Leadville" Brown *Chick-a-pen -- Molly Tobin and Johnny "Leadville" Brown *Keep-a-Hoppin' -- Johnny "Leadville" Brown and His Leadville Friends *Up Where the People Are -- Monte Carlo Guests *Dolce Far Niente -- Prince DeLong and Molly Tobin *Colorado, My Home -- Johnny "Leadville" Brown, Molly Tobin and Leadville Friends {{col-end}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * {{ibdb title|id=2267}} *[http://www.guidetomusicaltheatre.com/shows_u/unsinkable.htm Plot synopsis and other details at guidetomusicaltheatre.com] * [http://www.mtishows.com/show_detail.asp?showid=000076 ''The Unsinkable Molly Brown''] at the Music Theatre International website {{Meredith Willson}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Unsinkable Molly Brown, The}} [[Category:1960 musicals]] [[Category:Broadway musicals]] [[Category:Musicals inspired by real-life events]]

{{Use mdy dates|date=May 2015}} {{Infobox person | image = | caption = | birth_name = Thomas Miguel Guerra | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1985|02|23|mf=y}} | birth_place = [[Delano, California]], USA | home_town = [[Tulare, California]] , USA | occupation = landscape architect | years_active = | spouse = }}
'''Thomas Miguel Guerra''' (a.k.a. Ashton Lucian Chavez<ref name="abc7_additionalcharges">{{cite web|author=Lyanne Melendez |url=http://abc7news.com/health/man-accused-of-infecting-men-in-sf-socal-with-hiv/285791/ |title=Man accused of intentionally infecting men in San Francisco, SoCal with HIV |publisher=ABC7-San Francisco |date=2015-08-28 |accessdate=2015-05-07}}</ref> or Tomii Guerra<ref name="abc7_additionalcharges"/>) (born February 23, 1985) is an American landscape architect who became the first person in the state of [[California]] to be convicted for intentionally infecting another individual with [[HIV]]. In court, prosecutors presented 11,000 text messages and 36 audio clips to support their case against Guerra. Since then, Guerra has been accused of intentionally exposing dozens of other men to HIV.<ref name="washingtonpost_travesty">{{cite web|author=Michael E. Miller |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/morning-mix/wp/2015/05/05/man-who-knowingly-spread-hiv-sentenced-to-six-months-judge-calls-it-a-travesty/ |title=Man who knowingly spread HIV sentenced to six months. Judge calls it a 'travesty.' |publisher=Washington Post |date=2015-05-05 |accessdate=2015-05-07}}</ref><ref name="cbs8_plea">{{cite web|author=Marcella Lee |url=http://www.cbs8.com/story/28320968/man-pleads-no-contest-to-willfully-spreading-hiv |title=Man pleads no contest to willfully spreading HIV |publisher=CBS8-San Diego |date=2015-03-09 |accessdate=2015-05-07}}</ref><ref name="logo">{{cite web|author=Matthew Tharrett |url=http://www.newnownext.com/man-who-purposefully-infected-his-boyfriend-with-hiv-gets-six-months-in-prison/05/2015 |title=Man Who Purposefully Infected His Boyfriend With HIV Gets Six Months In Prison |publisher=Logo |date=2015-05-05 |accessdate=2015-05-06}}</ref> Guerra is the great-nephew of [[labor leader]] and [[civil rights]] activist [[Cesar Chavez]].<ref name="abc7_additionalcharges"/><ref name="nydailynews_sentencing">{{cite web|author=Deborah Hastings |url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/national/san-diego-man-6-months-jail-giving-lover-hiv-article-1.2211185 |title=San Diego man who intentionally spread HIV sentenced to 6 months in jail |publisher=NY Daily News |date=2015-05-05 |accessdate=2015-05-07}}</ref><ref name="abc30_charge">{{cite web|author=Mariana Jacob |url=http://abc30.com/news/man-accused-of-spreading-hiv-intentionally/284404/ |title=Man accused of spreading HIV intentionally |publisher=ABC30-Fresno |date=2015-08-27 |accessdate=2015-05-07}}</ref>
==HIV exposure conviction== Guerra's ex-boyfriend filed a complaint against him with San Diego police in August, 2013.<ref name="abc7_additionalcharges" /><ref name="advocate_guilty" /><ref name="cbsnews_august">{{cite web|author=Crimesider Staff |url=http://www.cbsnews.com/news/thomas-guerra-california-man-accused-of-intentionally-spreading-hiv/ |title=California man accused of intentionally spreading HIV |publisher=CBS News |date=2015-08-29 |accessdate=2015-05-07}}</ref>
On March 9, 2015, Guerra pleaded no contest to a misdemeanor charge of violating a California health code by failing to tell his former partner he was HIV positive. Guerra had previously pled not guilty and changed his plea the morning his trial was set to begin.<ref name="cbs8_plea" /><ref name="advocate_guilty">{{cite web|author=Neal Broverman |url=http://www.advocate.com/health/hiv-aids/2015/03/11/san-diego-man-pleads-guilty-spreading-hiv |title=San Diego Man Pleads Guilty to Spreading HIV |publisher=Advocate |date=2015-03-11 |accessdate=2015-05-07}}</ref><ref name="latimes_nocontest">{{cite web|author=Tony Perry |url=http://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-ln-hiv-plea-agreement-20150309-story.html |title=Man who fails to tell partner he is HIV positive pleads no contest |publisher=Los Angeles Times |date=2015-03-09 |accessdate=2015-05-06}}</ref> According to [[San Diego]] City Attorney [[Jan Goldsmith]], Guerra's case was the first prosecution of willful HIV transmission in San Diego. There had also been no previous successful prosecutions across the state since the California Legislature adopted the health statute in 1995.<ref name="cbs8_plea" /><ref name="logo" />
Additional victims came forward after the case received media publicity; they filed cases in various California cities stating that Guerra had lied to them about being HIV-negative.<ref name="abc7_additionalcharges" /><ref name="abc30_charge" /> Some of those cases are still pending.<ref name="abc7_additionalcharges" /><ref name="abc7_visalia">{{cite web|author=Mariana Jacob |url=http://abc7.com/news/visalia-man-says-another-man-knowingly-gave-him-hiv/397019/ |title=Visalia man says another man knowingly gave him HIV |publisher=ABC7-San Francisco |date=2015-11-13 |accessdate=2015-05-07}}</ref> Investigators found 11,000 text messages and videos in which Guerra laughed about lying to sexual partners about his HIV status.<ref name="abc7_sentence">{{cite web|author=Elex Michaelson |url=http://abc7.com/news/san-diego-man-who-knowingly-spread-hiv-sentenced-to-6-months/697009/ |title=San Diego man who knowingly spread HIV sentenced to 6 months |publisher=ABC7 |date=2015-05-05 |accessdate=2015-05-07}}</ref> "Yay lol. Someone getting poz that day," Guerra texted to a friend. "Poor Sucka."<ref name="washingtonpost_travesty"/><ref name="nydailynews_sentencing"/> On 5 May 2015 Guerra was sentenced to six months in jail.<ref name="washingtonpost_travesty" /><ref name="latimes_6months">{{cite web|author=Tony Perry |url=http://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-ln-hiv-positive-20150504-story.html |title=San Diego man sentenced to jail for not telling partner he is HIV positive |publisher=Los Angeles Times |date=2015-05-04 |accessdate=2015-05-06}}</ref>
Despite pressure to file the case as a felony, which would have carried a term of up to eight years in prison,<ref name="logo"/> San Diego District Attorney [[Bonnie Dumanis]] had twice declined to do so. At his sentencing hearing Guerra told Judge Lewis that he had "no remorse" for his actions. He blamed the victim, who he said was "reckless" because they had met on the gay dating site [[Grindr]].<ref name="washingtonpost_travesty" /><ref name="logo" />
Judge Lewis said she would have liked to have given Guerra a harsher sentence, but California statutes prevented her doing so:<ref name="washingtonpost_travesty" /><ref name="nydailynews_sentencing" /> "I don't think in my 25-plus years in law, I've ever seen somebody be so lacking of insight, blame or responsibility that you have demonstrated," she stated to Guerra before sentencing him to the maximum allowed per California statue, 6 months in jail.<ref name="logo" /><ref name="abc7_sentence" /> San Diego City Attorney Jan Goldsmith said in a statement that the sentence "was inadequate given the damage done to the victim and the danger to the public posed by [Guerra]."<ref name="logo" />

The '''International Military Tribunal for the Far East Charter''' (IMTFE Charter), also known as the '''Tokyo Charter''', was the decree issued by General [[Douglas MacArthur]], [[Supreme Commander for the Allied Powers]] in [[Allies of World War II|Allied]]-[[Occupation of Japan|occupied Japan]], on 19 January 1946 that set down the laws and procedures by which the [[Tokyo Trials]] were to be conducted. The charter was issued months following the [[surrender of Japan]] on September 2, 1945, which brought [[World War II]] to an end.<ref name=MAC>{{cite book |title=Crimes Against Humanity in International Criminal Law |date=July 27, 1999 |page=32 |author=M. Cherif Bassiouni |publisher=[[Wolters Kluwer]]}}</ref>
Modeled after the [[Nuremberg Charter]], the Tokyo Charter stipulated that crimes of the Japanese could be tried. Three categories of crimes were defined: [[crimes against peace]], [[war crime]]s, and [[crimes against humanity]]. Article 6 of the Tokyo Charter also stated that holding an official position or acting pursuant to [[Superior Orders|order of his government or of a superior]] was no defense to war crimes, but that such circumstances may be considered in mitigation of punishment if the Tribunal determines that justice so requires.
Like the [[Nuremberg Trials]], the [[criminal procedure]] used by the Tokyo Trials was closer to [[Civil law (legal system)|civil law]] than to [[common law]], with a trial before a panel of judges rather than a [[jury trial]] and with wide allowance for [[hearsay]] evidence. Defendants who were found guilty could [[appeal]] the verdict to the [[Allied Council for Japan]]. In addition, they would be permitted to present evidence in their defense and to [[cross-examination|cross-examine]] witnesses.
Unlike the Nuremberg Charter, the Tokyo Charter was not part of a treaty or agreement among the Allies but it was substantially the same as the Nuremberg Charter. A major exception was that [[Emperor Hirohito]] was excluded from being tried for crimes against peace, war crimes, and crimes against humanity.
The Tokyo Charter differs from the Nuremberg Charter, however, in two ways. The Tokyo Charter adds the categories of persons to be held responsible and it does not make "persecution" subject to "religious" grounds. The first variance is only in the drafting of Article 5(c) of the Tokyo Charter defining crimes against humanity since the same responsibility basis exists in the Charter thought not in Article 6(c) of the Nuremberg Charter. The second variance is because the [[The Holocaust|Nazi crimes against the Jews]] did not have a counterpart in the Asian conflict.
The Nuremberg and Tokyo Charters were applicable only to major criminals, leaving other criminals to be tried by the Allies. In Germany, the Allies acted pursuant to Control Council Law No. 10 (CCL 10)<ref>[http://avalon.law.yale.edu/imt/imt10.asp Nuremberg Trials Final Report Appendix D: Control Council Law No. 10]</ref> in their respective zones of occupation. But they also relied on their military and national tribunals, where they applied their own laws. There was no counterpart in Japan to CCL 10 because the United States was the sole occupying power of Japan, whereas Germany was occupied by the four major Allies (United States, Great Britain, France, and the Soviet Union). The same legal issues pertaining to Article 6(c) of the Nuremberg Charter also apply to Article 5(c) of the Tokyo Charter.<ref name=MAC />
